ARABIC: وَٱلْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَٰهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَٱلْعُرْجُونِ ٱلْقَدِيمِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And We have decreed set phases for the moon, until it ends up looking like an old palm spathe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We have determined the stations of the moon, so that (after its wanderings) it returns as a dried up inflorescent spike of dates.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We have appointed stages for the moon till it returns in the shape of a dry old branch of palm-tree.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: how We ordained the moon to pass through certain phases until it seems eventually to be like a bent twig;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And We have appointed positions for the moon till it returns like an old branch of the date palm.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And the moon, We have decreed for it stages, till it returns like the old dried curved date stalk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And (as for) the moon, We have ordained for it stages till it becomes again as an old dry palm branch.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And the moon -- We have determined it by stations, till it returns like an aged palm-bough.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And for the moon We have appointed mansions till she return like an old shrivelled palm-leaf.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have ordained phases for the moon until finally it becomes like an old date-stalk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the moon! For it We have decreed mansions till it reverteth like the old branch of a palm-tree.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: As for the moon, We have ordained its phases, until it becomes like an old palm leaf.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And the Moon,- We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till she returns like the old (and withered) lower part of a date-stalk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And the moon, We have measured for it mansions (to traverse) till it returns like the old dried curved date stalk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And the moon, We have determined it in phases till it returns like an old palmbranch.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the moon: We have disposed it in phases, until it returns like the old twig.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:39] And the moon — (read wa’l-qamaru, in the nominative, or wa’l-qamara, in the accusative; and it may be in   the accusative because of a following verb that governs it) We have determined it, with respect to its course, [to run] in phases — twenty eight phases in twenty eight nights of every month; it becomes concealed for two nights when the month has thirty days, and for one night when it has twenty nine days — until it returns, during its final phase seeming to the [human] eye, like an aged palm-bough, in other words, like the stalk with a date cluster when it ages, becoming delicate, arched and yellowish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And for the moon We have appointed mansions) like the mansions of the sun: it increases and decreases (till she return like an old shrivelled palm leaf.
